title: France allows refugees with non-EU medical certifications to practice
text:
France has allowed refugees with non-EU medical qualifications to practice during the COVID-19 response.

Refugees whose diplomas have not yet been recognised, or who have not passed knowledge verification tests can now practice as associates, under the responsibility of another doctor. Sante Publique France led the call, aiming to strengthen the country’s health system during the crisis.
url: Mobilisation citoyenne : les réfugiés diplômés hors UE peuvent contribuer au service public de santé (Government of France)

title: Seine-et-Marne recruits refugees to fill labour gaps in agriculture
text:
Seine-et-Marne has recruited refugees to fill gaps created by a halt in seasonal worker migration due to COVID-19.

Refugees from local migrant and asylum shelters were recruited to pick ripe strawberries and asparagus, and plant produce to harvest in June.

Seine-et-Marne’s produce is essential for supplying Paris and the Ile-de-France region more broadly.
stats: France currently lacks 200,000 agricultural workers due to COVID-19
url: Main d’œuvre saisonnière, les réfugiés en renfort! (Prefet De Seine-et-Marne)

title: Norway sends healthcare staff to Italy
text:
Norway has sent a team of 25 doctors, nurses, and logistical staff, to aid Italy’s COVID-19 response. The team is based in Lombardy, Italy’s worst-hit region.

Many of the medics had previously helped in the Democratic Republic of Congo  during the Ebola crisis.
quote-text: Solidarity in Europe is not a theoretical exercise… We must help each other when a crisis hits'.
url: Solidarity in Europe': Norway to Send Team to Italy to Help Fight COVID-19 (NY Times)

title: Portugal regularises all migrants and asylum seekers
text:
Portugal has regularised all migrants and asylum seekers.

All migrants and asylum seekers now have the same rights and social benefits as all citizens, following a government announcement that all immigrants with pending residence permit applications have been regularised.
quote-text: ‘Ensuring the access of migrant citizens to health, social security and job and housing stability is a duty of a solidary society in times of crisis’.
quote-author: Eduardo Cabrita, Minister of Internal Administration
url: Governo regulariza todos os imigrantes que tenham pedidos pendentes no SEF (Publico)

title: UK automatically renews visas for all foreign NHS workers
text:
UK NHS migrant doctors, nurses and paramedics and their families have had their work visas - set to expire before 1 October 2020 - automatically extended for a year free of charge to focus on fighting COVID-19.

Restrictions on the amount of hours student nurses and doctors are allowed to work have also been lifted, with pre-registered migrant nurses given more time to pass their exams to ensure the surge in patients was met.
quote-text: ‘We owe them a great deal of gratitude for all that they do.’
stats: 12% of NHS healthcare workers are foreign-born
url: Coronavirus: Thousands of foreign NHS workers to have UK visas extended for one year (Independent)
